abstracts.cdata!:
Of the three components to the Karst
            Ecosystem Conservation Project for Croatia, the only
            component with potential negative environmental impacts is
            Component 2, which establishes community-based mechanisms
            for biodiversity conservation and sustainable resources use,
            and supports civil works to improve protected area
            facilities and management. Mitigating measures are outlined
            as follows: Dust from transporting and handling construction
            works will be minimized by water and other means such as
            enclosure of construction sites. To reduce noise,
            construction will be restricted during certain hours. All
            debris, construction, and wood waste will be stored within
            the work site. Wood waste will be stored separately and
            arranged for recycling. Open burning and illegal dumping
            will not be permitted. Proper sites for earth/clay and sand
            dispersal will be determined and prior approval from
            relevant authority for disposal obtained. Stockpiling
            construction debris on-site will be avoided and waste
            disposed regularly at an authorized dumping ground. Debris
            chutes will transfer debris efficiently from higher floors
            to the ground floor to prevent nuisance. New campsites
            selection will be based on a criteria that will minimize
            impacts on fauna and flora. New trail design will consider a
            set of criteria including slope, drainage, susceptibility to
            soil erosion, and traffic management. Identifying suitable
            sites and using garbage receptacles will prevent degradation
            of site conditions.
